comments: Ramanujan used the form Sum_{k>=0} x^(k^2) / (Product_{i=1..k} 1-(-x)^i), which is obtained by changing the sign of x. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 20 2003Coefficients in expansion of determinant of infinite tridiagonal matrix shown below in powers of x^2 (Lehmer 1973) :1 x 0 0 0 0 0 ...x 1 x^2 0 0 0 ...0 x^2 1 x^3 0 0 ...0 0 x^3 1 x^4 0 0 0 ......................Convolution inverse of A003116.
references: N. J. Fine, Basic Hypergeometric Series and Applications, Amer. Math. Soc., 1988; p. 55, Eq. (26.11).
G. H. Hardy, P. V. Seshu Aiyar and B. M. Wilson, editors, Collected Papers of Srinivasa Ramanujan, Cambridge, 1923; p. 354.
D. H. Lehmer, Course on History of Mathematics, Univ. Calif. Berkeley, 1973.
_Herman P. Robinson_, personal communication to _N. J. A. Sloane_.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
mathematica: CoefficientList[ Series[ Sum[x^k^2*(-1)^k / Product[1-x^i,{i,1,k}], {k,0,100}], {x,0,100}],x][[1 ;; 72]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Apr 08 2011 *)a[ n_] := If[n < 0, 0, SeriesCoefficient[ Sum[ (-1)^k x^k^2 / QPochhammer[ x, x, k], {k, 0, Sqrt[n]}], {x, 0, n}]] (* _Michael Somos_, Jan 04 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( sum(k=0, sqrtint(n), x^k^2 / prod(i=1, k, x^i - 1, 1 + x * O(x^n))), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 20 2003 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
